name: BNF.Carbamazepine.Carbamazepine
interactioninfo: Carbamazepine is predicted to decrease the exposure to abacavir.
Carbamazepine is predicted to decrease the exposure to abiraterone. Manufacturer advises avoid.
Concurrent use of carbamazepine and aceclofenac can increase the risk of hyponatraemia.
Concurrent use of carbamazepine and acemetacin can increase the risk of hyponatraemia.
Carbamazepine decreases the effects of acenocoumarol. Manufacturer advises monitor and adjust dose.
Carbamazepine is predicted to decrease the exposure to afatinib.
Carbamazepine decreases the concentration of albendazole.
Concurrent use of carbamazepine and alcohol (beverage) can increase the risk of hepatotoxicity.
Concurrent use of carbamazepine and alectinib can increase the risk of hepatotoxicity.
Carbamazepine is predicted to decrease the effects of alfacalcidol.
Carbamazepine is predicted to decrease the exposure to alfentanil.
Carbamazepine decreases the exposure to aliskiren.
Carbamazepine is predicted to decrease the exposure to alprazolam. Manufacturer advises adjust dose.
Concurrent use of carbamazepine and amiloride can increase the risk of hyponatraemia.
Concurrent use of carbamazepine and amitriptyline can increase the risk of hyponatraemia.
Carbamazepine decreases the exposure to amitriptyline. Manufacturer advises adjust dose.
Carbamazepine is predicted to decrease the exposure to amlodipine. Manufacturer advises monitor and adjust dose.
Carbamazepine is predicted to moderately decrease the exposure to apixaban. Manufacturer advises use with caution or avoid.
Carbamazepine moderately decreases the exposure to apremilast. Manufacturer advises avoid.
Carbamazepine is predicted to markedly decrease the exposure to aprepitant. Manufacturer advises avoid.
Carbamazepine is predicted to moderately decrease the exposure to aripiprazole. Manufacturer advises adjust aripiprazole dose.
Carbamazepine is predicted to decrease the exposure to artemether (with lumafantrine). Manufacturer advises avoid.
Concurrent use of carbamazepine and asparaginase can increase the risk of hepatotoxicity.
Atazanavir is predicted to increase the exposure to carbamazepine and carbamazepine is predicted to decrease the exposure to atazanavir. Manufacturer advises monitor and adjust dose.
Concurrent use of carbamazepine and atorvastatin can increase the risk of hepatotoxicity.
Carbamazepine is predicted to decrease the exposure to atorvastatin. Manufacturer advises monitor and adjust dose.
Carbamazepine is predicted to decrease the effects of (but acute use increases the effects of) atracurium. Manufacturer advises monitor and adjust dose.
Carbamazepine is predicted to decrease the exposure to avanafil. Manufacturer advises avoid.
Carbamazepine is predicted to decrease the exposure to axitinib. Manufacturer advises avoid or adjust dose.
Carbamazepine is predicted to decrease the exposure to bazedoxifene.
Carbamazepine decreases the exposure to bedaquiline. Manufacturer advises avoid.
Concurrent use of carbamazepine and bendroflumethiazide can increase the risk of hyponatraemia.
Carbamazepine slightly decreases the exposure to bortezomib. Manufacturer advises avoid.
Carbamazepine affects the exposure to bosentan. Manufacturer advises avoid.
Carbamazepine is predicted to very markedly decrease the exposure to bosutinib. Manufacturer advises avoid.
Carbamazepine is predicted to decrease the effects of brentuximab vedotin.
Carbamazepine decreases the concentration of brivaracetam.
Carbamazepine is predicted to decrease the exposure to budesonide. Manufacturer advises monitor and adjust dose.
Concurrent use of carbamazepine and bumetanide can increase the risk of hyponatraemia.
Carbamazepine is predicted to decrease the exposure to buprenorphine. Manufacturer advises monitor and adjust dose.
Carbamazepine is predicted to markedly decrease the exposure to bupropion.
Carbamazepine is predicted to decrease the exposure to buspirone. Manufacturer advises use with caution and adjust dose.
Carbamazepine is predicted to decrease the exposure to cabazitaxel. Manufacturer advises avoid.
Carbamazepine moderately decreases the exposure to cabozantinib. Manufacturer advises avoid.

name: BNF.Lansoprazole.Lansoprazole
interactioninfo: Lansoprazole decreases the exposure to atazanavir. Manufacturer advises avoid or adjust dose.
Lansoprazole is predicted to decrease the absorption of bosutinib.
Lansoprazole is predicted to decrease the absorption of ceritinib.
Lansoprazole is predicted to decrease the exposure to dabrafenib. Manufacturer advises avoid.
Lansoprazole is predicted to slightly to moderately decrease the exposure to dasatinib. Manufacturer advises avoid.
Lansoprazole is predicted to decrease the absorption of dipyridamole (immediate release tablets).
Lansoprazole is predicted to slightly decrease the exposure to erlotinib. Manufacturer advises avoid.
Fluconazole is predicted to increase the exposure to lansoprazole.
Fluvoxamine is predicted to increase the exposure to lansoprazole.
Lansoprazole is predicted to decrease the exposure to gefitinib.
Lansoprazole decreases the absorption of itraconazole. Manufacturer advises administer itraconazole capsules with an acidic beverage.
Lansoprazole decreases the absorption of ketoconazole. Manufacturer advises administer ketoconazole with an acidic beverage.
Lansoprazole is predicted to decrease the exposure to ledipasvir. Manufacturer advises adjust dose, see sofosbuvir with ledipasvir.
Lumacaftor is predicted to decrease the exposure to lansoprazole. Manufacturer advises adjust dose.
Lansoprazole decreases the clearance of methotrexate. Manufacturer advises use with caution or avoid.
Lansoprazole is predicted to decrease the exposure to pazopanib. Manufacturer advises avoid or administer concurrently without food.
Lansoprazole decreases the absorption of posaconazole (oral suspension). Manufacturer advises avoid.
Lansoprazole is predicted to decrease the exposure to rilpivirine. Manufacturer advises avoid.
Lansoprazole increases the exposure to saquinavir. Manufacturer advises avoid.
Lansoprazole potentially decreases the exposure to sofosbuvir. Manufacturer advises adjust dose, see sofosbuvir with ledipasvir and sofosbuvir with velpatasvir.
Tipranavir decreases the exposure to lansoprazole. Manufacturer advises avoid.
Lansoprazole is predicted to decrease the concentration of velpatasvir. Manufacturer advises adjust dose, see sofosbuvir with velpatasvir.

name: BNF.Levofloxacin.Levofloxacin
interactioninfo: Aceclofenac potentially increases the risk of seizures when given with levofloxacin.

Sulindac potentially increases the risk of seizures when given with levofloxacin.

name: BNF.Nitrofurantoin.Nitrofurantoin
interactioninfo: Nitrofurantoin is predicted to increase the risk of methaemoglobinaemia when given with dapsone.
Magnesium trisilicate decreases the absorption of nitrofurantoin.
Nitrofurantoin is predicted to increase the risk of methaemoglobinaemia when given with topical prilocaine. Manufacturer advises use with caution or avoid.

name: BNF.Omeprazole.Omeprazole
interactioninfo: Omeprazole decreases the exposure to atazanavir. Manufacturer advises avoid or adjust dose.
Omeprazole is predicted to decrease the absorption of bosutinib.
Omeprazole is predicted to decrease the absorption of ceritinib.
Omeprazole is predicted to increase the exposure to cilostazol. Manufacturer advises adjust cilostazol dose.
Omeprazole slightly to moderately increases the exposure to citalopram. Manufacturer advises monitor and adjust dose.
Omeprazole is predicted to decrease the efficacy of clopidogrel. Manufacturer advises avoid.
Omeprazole is predicted to decrease the exposure to dabrafenib. Manufacturer advises avoid.
Omeprazole is predicted to slightly to moderately decrease the exposure to dasatinib. Manufacturer advises avoid.
Omeprazole is predicted to decrease the absorption of dipyridamole (immediate release tablets).
Enzalutamide is predicted to moderately decrease the exposure to omeprazole.
Omeprazole is predicted to slightly decrease the exposure to erlotinib. Manufacturer advises avoid.
Omeprazole slightly to moderately increases the exposure to escitalopram. Manufacturer advises monitor and adjust dose.
Fluconazole is predicted to increase the exposure to omeprazole.
Fluvoxamine is predicted to increase the exposure to omeprazole.
Omeprazole is predicted to decrease the exposure to gefitinib.
Omeprazole decreases the absorption of itraconazole. Manufacturer advises administer itraconazole capsules with an acidic beverage.
Omeprazole decreases the absorption of ketoconazole. Manufacturer advises administer ketoconazole with an acidic beverage.
Omeprazole is predicted to decrease the exposure to ledipasvir. Manufacturer advises adjust dose, see sofosbuvir with ledipasvir.
Lumacaftor is predicted to decrease the exposure to omeprazole. Manufacturer advises adjust dose.
Omeprazole decreases the clearance of methotrexate. Manufacturer advises use with caution or avoid.
Omeprazole is predicted to decrease the exposure to pazopanib. Manufacturer advises avoid or administer concurrently without food.
Omeprazole decreases the absorption of posaconazole (oral suspension). Manufacturer advises avoid.
Rifampicin is predicted to moderately decrease the exposure to omeprazole.
Omeprazole is predicted to decrease the exposure to rilpivirine. Manufacturer advises avoid.
Omeprazole increases the exposure to saquinavir. Manufacturer advises avoid.
Omeprazole potentially decreases the exposure to sofosbuvir. Manufacturer advises adjust dose, see sofosbuvir with ledipasvir and sofosbuvir with velpatasvir.
Tipranavir decreases the exposure to omeprazole. Manufacturer advises avoid.
Omeprazole is predicted to decrease the concentration of velpatasvir. Manufacturer advises adjust dose, see sofosbuvir with velpatasvir.
Voriconazole increases the exposure to omeprazole. Manufacturer advises adjust dose.

Increasing age, female sex, cardiac disease, and some metabolic disturbances (notably hypokalaemia) predispose to QT prolongation.
